cards.name: Amnesia

cards.name: Balance
cards.oracle_text: Each player chooses a number of lands they control equal to the number of lands controlled by the player who controls the fewest, then sacrifices the rest. Players discard cards and sacrifice creatures the same way.

—Endrek Sahr, Master Breeder

cards.name: Darkness
cards.flavor_text: "If I must die, I will encounter darkness as a bride,/ And hug it in my arms." —William Shakespeare, *Measure for Measure*

cards.name: Demonic Hordes
cards.flavor_text: Created to destroy Dominia, Demons can sometimes be bent to a more focused purpose.

"There is no gain without sacrifice."

cards.flavor_text: We asked Captain Soll what became of the Serafina, but all he said was, "Ships that go down shouldn't come back up."

When this creature enters, it deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Elven Fortress
cards.flavor_text:
"Thallids are not ordinary enemies of flesh and bone and reason. They attack with no thought for our strength or of their own losses. I fear our Fortresses shall be overwhelmed."
—Kyliki of Havenwood

cards.name: Elvish Hunter
cards.flavor_text:
"Elves often tipped their arrows with a drug that caused a deep but harmless sleep."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. III*
cards.oracle_text: {1}{G}, {T}: Target creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

cards.name: Elvish Scout
cards.flavor_text: Even one whose ears were closely tuned to the sounds of Havenwood could miss hearing a Scout move past.

cards.name: Eternal Flame
cards.oracle_text: Eternal Flame deals X damage to target opponent or planeswalker and half X damage, rounded up, to you, where X is the number of Mountains you control.

cards.name: Exorcist
cards.flavor_text: Though they often bore little greater charm than the demons they battled, exorcists were always welcome in Scarwood.

cards.name: Farrelite Priest
cards.flavor_text: Although their methods were often brutal, Farrel's followers believed in the preservation of justice and virtue.

cards.name: Giant Shark

This creature can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.

When you control no Islands, sacrifice this creature.
